text:
e="preserve">Vladimir Borisovich Korenev (; June 20, 1940 – January 2, 2021) was a Soviet-Russian actor and teacher. He was awarded People's Artist of Russia in 1998. Korenev was born in Sevastopol, Soviet Union. He was known for his roles in "Amphibian Man", "Children of Don Quixote" and "Criminal Talent". His career began in 1962.
Korenev died of COVID-19 on January 2, 2020 in Moscow, aged 80.
